intro: Selago elegans, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its bulbs are perennial, allowing it to return year after year in suitable conditions. Selago elegans is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
